New Records: Shohei Ohtani, Mookie Betts, and Freddie Freeman became the first trio in Dodgers' history to hit consecutive home runs at the start of a game.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani, Mookie Betts, and Freddie Freeman hit consecutive home runs in the first inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Chase Field with a crowd of 50,041 fans.
Others: The game was the first of a best-of-five series.
